intro: Capsella herjedalica, commonly known as the Herjedal clockweed, is a flowering plant species native to the Nordic regions. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, and it has slender, erect stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Capsella herjedalica is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a minor weed in agricultural settings.
